All submains dressed in the formation specified on Fredon sub main installation check sheet.
When using a winch, maximum cable pulling tensions are not to be exceeded, refer to cable manufacturer's technical data for maximum pulling tension

All fire rated submains have been dressed with steel cable ties NOTE: Essential Safety Services require their own Fire Rated Support and cable pathway
Mechanical protection installed where required.
No cables to be tied to or supported by sprinkler / water pipes.
All submains have been kept clear of sharp edges during installation to avoid damage to insulation.

Location & Position of Switchboard
Supply Authority Access Requirements
Physical Clearances in & around switchboard area
Ensure proposed switchboard location is secure
Doors on rooms / cupboards etc.
Signage is installed
Structural supports in place
Carry out pre-delivery inspection at workshop
Inspect workmanship and take quality control photograph. Attach or take photo of weight & lifting information
Confirm has the manufacturer supplied workshop QA & FAT documentation
Fredon to issue switchboards FAT documentation for review
Check for obvious signs of damage DO NOT ACCEPT DELIVERY IF DAMAGED
Check for delivery of quality control and quality checklist completed from factory DO NOT ACCEPT DELIVERY IF NO DOCUMENTS
Plan and resource installation task appropriately
Use only proprietary lifting and rolling equipment
Clear route to switchboard installation location
Clear installation area completely of any obstacles, rubbish, personnel etc.
Switchboard mounted using correct fixings with additional structural support added where required
Switchboard mounted in a position to allow all correct clearances around the switchboard to satisfy all standards, specs and regulations
Remove all covers and inspection panels from board, carry out the following checks & inspections:
Visually inspect for damage
Visually inspect for cleanliness within boards
Visually inspect for loose cables & bars
Visually inspect for loose breakers, fuses and switches
Visually inspect all metering and control equipment
Using appropriate tension tools and equipment, physically check tension of switchboard connections (switches, circuit breakers, control compontents etc.)
NOTE: Switchboard connections may have come loose during transit
Using a calibrated tester physically confirm functionality of ALL isolation devices
Confirm "OFF" is off (open state) by physical operation
Confirm "ON" is on (closed state) by physical operation
Review all protective device trip settings in accordance with engineers design, discrimination and cascade reports
Fredon consultant to issue the discrimination study report for review and approval
Review all metering, fuses and control equipment wiring
Using as built / as constructed documentation confirm general arrangement, SLD and schematics are correct
Confirm signage and labels on board are correct
Confirm schedule is updated and inside board
Carry out insulation resistance test to confirm integrity of switchboard insulation between all active conductors and all neutrals AND earths
Reinstate ALL cover panels, close doors and lock etc.

ITP 175 In Ground Works
Ensure that the latest revision drawings and specifications are being referred to

Prior to installation submit conduit shop drawing for review to the satisfaction of structural engineer
Ensure that the latest service & co-ordinated drawings are being referenced

Engage certified surveyor for critical set out works
Identify circuit to be installed, confirm circuit cabling requirement. Select conduit size accordingly
Conduit to be measured and cut using correct tools
All conduit bends to be sweeping using bending spring. Or large sweeping proprietary bends
All joins to be glued using PVC jointing cement
All conduit boxes to be correct type with correct number of entry points i.e. 2way, 3way T, 4way
Do not use corrugated conduit in decks
Ensure entire conduit installation is fixed to steel work using tie wire
Conduit should be tied to bottom mat of steel
Ensure conduit installation is supported from deck over entire length
Where deck is post tension and steel support is minimal, use deck chairs and spare steel

Ensure that the void/materials are fixed securely at its final location with the correct dimensions to allow the final equipment to be installed at FFL and Adjacent to walls Floor Boxes & Cast in Light's etc
Ensure sufficient concrete cover can be achieved
Complete as installed conduit drawing showing all conduits. Photograph area of works.
Ensure that if the slab may be used as a floor for showers and bathrooms have an equipotential bond to the steel reinforcement.
Observe concrete pour with particular attention to critical area
Ensure that all changes made to the original drawing have been marked and noted on the Working Drawing located in the Site Office. These drawings MUST be kept updated for use as As built drawings.
Cross check and verify that the As Built Drawings are Complete and Correct
